title: TCP vs UDP
content: UDP is connectionless and lower latency
TCP guarantees delivery and order; UDP does not
TCP uses flow and congestion control; UDP leaves it to the app

title: IPv6 Basics
content: IPv6 uses 128-bit addresses for a vastly larger space
Notation is eight groups of hexadecimal, with compression rules
Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) can assign addresses
Built-in support for multicast replaces IPv4 broadcast

title: Round Robin Scheduling
content: Each task gets a fixed time slice in a rotating order
Prevents starvation by guaranteeing CPU time
Short time slices improve responsiveness but add overhead
Common in time-sharing systems and simple schedulers

title: Load Balancing 101
content: Distributes traffic across servers to improve reliability
Health checks remove unhealthy instances from rotation
Strategies include round robin, least connections, and hash
Can be implemented at L4 or L7 depending on needs
